choices.D: For a given concept, what % of cases will the model detect.
choices.B: For a given concept, what % of cases will the model not detect.
choices.C: For a given concept what % of cases will the model correctly predict.
choices.A: For a given concept what % of cases will the model incorrectly predict.

questions.question_text: Which of the below is the correct definition of "recall" in UiPath Communications Mining?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Recall is the proportion of all possible true positives that were identified. And, 
Precision is the proportion of all the predictions that were actually correct.

Selected Answer: A
Sources
A 'source' refers to a raw collection of messages which can grow over time. For example, a source could be all the responses collected to a survey, the emails in a team mailbox, the transcripts in a messaging channel, or all of the calls against a telephone number.

Sources are added to datasets in order to build a model to interpret and structure the messages within them.

Each source can be added to up to 10 different datasets.

questions.question_text: What is the definition of a UiPath Communications Mining data source?

choices.B: The model that we create when training the platform to understand the data in those sources.
choices.D: A user-permissioned project containing a taxonomy with labels and entities.
choices.C: A permissioned storage area within the platform which contains communications and labels.
choices.A: A collection of raw unlabeled communications data of a similar type, that can be associated with up to 10 datasets.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Configure Extractors Wizard accessed via the Data Extraction Scope allows you to choose which extractors are applied to each document type and field. It can be opened from the body of the activity, by clicking on the Configure Extractors button.

questions.question_text: Which is the correct description of the Configure Extractors Wizard?

choices.C: A mandatory step in the extractor configuration that allows choosing which extractors are applied to each document type.
choices.B: A mandatory step in the extractor configuration that allows choosing which extractors are applied to each document type and field.
choices.A: A mandatory step in the extractor configuration that allows choosing which extractors are applied to each field.
choices.D: An optional step in the extractor configuration which allows choosing which extractors are applied to each document type.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Coverage
Coverage is a term frequently used in Machine Learning and relates to how well a model 'covers' the data it's used to analyse. In Communications Mining, this relates to the proportion of messages in the dataset that have informative label predictions, and is presented in Validation as a percentage score.

'Informative labels' are those labels that the platform understands to be useful as standalone labels, by looking at how frequently they're assigned with other labels. Labels that are always assigned with another label, e.g. parent labels that are never assigned on their own or 'Urgent' if it's always assigned with another label, are down-weighted when the score is calculated.

The visual below gives an indication of what low coverage versus high coverage would look like across an entire dataset. Imagine the shaded circles are messages that have informative label predictions.

questions.question_text: Which UiPath Communications Mining model performance factor assesses the proportion of the entire dataset that has informative label predictions?
What is the difference between OCR (Optical Character Recognition) and IntelligentOCR?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
IntelligentOCR is a package within UiPath that can utilized within your process.

choices.D: IntelligentOCR is a UiPath Studio activity package that contains all the activities needed to enable information extraction, while OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is a method that reads text from images, recognizing each character and its position.
choices.B: IntelligentOCR is simply a rebranding of the OCR (Optical Character Recognition), both of them being methods that read text from images, recognizing each character and its position.
choices.C: OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is a UiPath Studio activity package that contains IntelligentOCR as an activity used to read text from images, recognizing each character and its position. OCR is widely used in Document Understanding processes.
choices.A: OCR (Optical Character Recognition) is a method that reads text from images, recognizing each character and its position, while IntelligentOCR is an enhanced version of it that can also work with noisier input data.
